Measuring your 
pregnancy
Doctors and midwives in the 
UK measure the duration of 
pregnancy	from	the	first	day	
of your last menstrual period, 
not from the day you conceive. 
So when you are ‘four weeks 
pregnant’, it is actually about 
two weeks after you conceived. 
Pregnancy normally lasts for 
37–42	weeks	from	the	first	day
